info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:21AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BENTON...WEST CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN ADAIR COUNTIES... At 321 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Westville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Siloam Springs... Lincoln... Westville... Watts... Cincinnati... Lake Francis... Ballard... Wedington... Rhea... Summers... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
